items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Juan Cruz, Assistant Superintendent of Instructional Services, and Kirsten King, Director of Instructional Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:05 p.m. on a Charter School Renewal Petition from KIPP San Jose Collegiate
	 
	 
BACKGROUND
	 
Public Charter Schools are approved initially for up to a five (5) year period and at the end of that time must apply for a charter school renewal for a term of five (5) years and continue to apply for renewal after each five (5) year term. Pursuant to Education Code 47605 a public hearing is required within thirty (30) days following the submission of a renewal charter school petition to the district.  The renewal petition was submitted to the district on October 18, 2012.
	 
During the Public Hearing the Governing Board of the school district shall consider the level of support for the petition by the teachers employed by the district, other employees of the district and parents.  The Governing Board shall either grant or deny the charter renewal within sixty (60) days of receipt of the petition; however, the date may be extended by an additional thirty (30) days if both parties agree to the extension.  Such agreement has been reached and at the December 6, 2012 Board Meeting the Governing Board shall make its determination.
	 
	 
FUNDING SOURCE: 
Part of Review Process
	 
FISCAL IMPACT: 
Part of Review Process
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Hold Public Hearing to consider level of support for the petition renewal submitted by KIPP San Jose Collegiate.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  9.02
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Cari Vaeth, Director, Human Resources and Vida L. Branner, Director of Compensation and Classified Employee Relations
					 
SUBJECT:
Hold Public Hearing at Approximately 6:10 p.m.
					Regarding Tentative Agreement and Memorandum of Understanding Re: Furlough Days (“MOU”) with the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, July 1, 2012 – June 30, 2013 and Disclosure of Major Provisions of Tentative Agreement (AB1200) 
					 
	 
In accordance with Assembly Bill 1200 requiring school districts to disclose, at a public meeting, the cost that would be incurred by the implementation of a collective bargaining agreement.  In meeting the requirement, a public hearing is being held to give our community an opportunity to comment on the cost of this tentative agreement.
	 
Attached is a copy of the Tentative Agreement and MOU which include the proposed changes to the collective bargaining agreement with the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, for the period July 1, 2012 - June 30, 2013.  The District and the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187 reached a tentative agreement on October 24, 2012, as reflected in the attached Tentative Agreement, and reached agreement on the MOU on that same date.  The Tentative Agreement and the MOU were each ratified and approved by CSEA, Chapter 187, on November 1, 2012.  We are submitting these agreements to the Board of Trustees for ratification and approval.
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
Administration recommends that the Board of Trustees accept any comment on the Tentative Agreement and MOU between the East Side Union High School District and the California School Employees Association, Chapter 187, for the period July 1, 2012 – June 30, 2013 and Disclosure of Major Provisions of Tentative Agreement (AB1200).

Item:  11.01
	 
	 
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Receive Second Reading and Adoption of Proposed Amended Board Bylaw #9270 
Conflict of Interest Code: Revolving Door Policy and #9270E (Appendix A) 
Designated Positions/Disclosure Categories
	 
	 
	 
Pursuant to the Government Code, the District is required to adopt a conflict of interest code. The District's conflict of interest code is contained in Board Bylaw 9270. The Government Code and the Rules and Regulations adopted by the Fair Political Practices Commission require the District to designate positions which are required to submit disclosures of financial interests, and to update the titles of positions when new positions are created, when position titles are changed, or when positions or position duties are revised or modified to fall within the disclosure categories. The changes reflected in the attached draft proposed revised Board Bylaw 9270 and 9270E (Appendix A) reflect revisions requested by County Counsel and also include the positions of Director III, Director of Special Services, District Architect, Project Manager and Senior Manager of Internal Controls within the category of positions required to submit disclosures, and delete the Interim Superintendent of Schools position. 
. 
	 
	 
	 
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board receive the second reading and adopt the proposed amendment to Board Bylaw 9270 and 9270E (Appendix A) thereto as presented.

TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Juan Cruz, Assistant Superintendent of Instructional Services, and
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Receive and Approve Facilities Usage Fee Schedule and Fair Market Rental Rates
	 
After an extensive analysis of the fees and rates that surrounding districts charge for the use of their facilities and what our current cost for services are, the District's Facilities Usage Fee Schedule and Fair Market Rental Rates were updated.  We made sure that the direct costs were in line with what it cost the District to operate the facilities and that the rental rates were in the middle range of what the surrounding districts' rates are.
	 
The District met with youth organizations that are currently using district facilities to reassure them that we are committed to continue to support their activities on our campuses.  Their rates were discounted as per new Board Policy 1330.
	 
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
âIt is recommended that the Board receive and approve Facilities Usage Fee Schedule and Fair Market Rental Rates.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
	 
Item:  11.06
Amended
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Discussion, Consideration and/or Action to Reschedule December 6, 2012, 
Annual Organizational and Regular Board Meeting
	 
	 
The Education Code provides that newly elected Board members shall participate in the Board’s annual organizational meeting at which Board officers are elected.  Education Code section 35143 provides in part:
	 
"The governing board of each school district shall hold an annual organizational meeting. In a year in which a regular election for governing board members is conducted, the meeting shall be held on a day within a 15-day period that commences with the date upon which a governing board member elected at that election takes office."  (Emphasis added.)
	 
The Board’s Organizational and next Regular Meeting is currently scheduled for Thursday, December 6, 2012.  However, Education Code section 5017 provides:
	 
"Each person elected at a regular biennial governing board member election shall hold office for a term of four years commencing on the first Friday in December next succeeding his or her election.  Any member of the governing board of a school district or community college district whose term has expired shall continue to discharge the duties of the office until his or her successor has qualified. The term of the successor shall begin upon the expiration of the term of his or her predecessor." (emphasis added.)
	 
Magdalena Carrasco has been elected to the ESUHSD Board.  In this case, the first Friday in December is December 7, which is the commencement of her four year term.  However, the Board’s organizational meeting is currently scheduled for the day before, December 6, on a date when Ms. Carrasco is not yet qualified to hold office or participate in the Board meeting.    
	 
Thus, because the Organizational Meeting cannot take place without Ms. Carrasco’s involvement (Educ. Code 35143), it will have to be rescheduled to a date when she is qualified to hold office and within 15 days after Ms. Carrasco takes office.
	 
	 
Recommendation:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees amend the 2012 Annual Organizational and Regular Board Meeting Calendar as stipulated by the Board of Trustees to a date in December on which Ms. Carrasco can participate as a seated and sworn Board member.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees amend the 2012 Annual Organizational and Regular Board Meeting Calendar as stipulated by the Board of Trustees to a date in December on which Ms. Carrasco can participate as a seated and sworn Board member.

items.item_details:
Item:  12.01
	 
	 
TO:
Board of Trustees
				 
				 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
				 
				 
PREPARED BY:
Juan Cruz, Assistant Superintendent of Instructional Services
				 
				 
SUBJECT:
Authorization for the District to Apply for the Linked Learning Pilot Grant
	 
The District is requesting authorization from the Governing Board to submit an application to be selected as one of the 20 school districts statewide that will receive assistance in developing district wide college and career pathways.  The application requires commitment from the Governing Board to move in this direction and support from various partners: feeder districts, post secondary institutions, community agencies, and industry sectors.
	 
Linked Learning is an approach that transforms students' high school experience by bringing together strong academics, demanding career and technical education, and real-world experience to help students gain an advantage in high school, post secondary education, and careers.  Linked Learning has four basic components: a challenging academic component, a technical component, a work-based learning component, and support services.  These components are offered through "pathways".
	 
With Linked Learning Pilot Program, the State seeks to:
Expand the number of high schools transforming how they prepare students for college and careers
Expand the number of students who are more fully prepared for college and career
Collect outcome data on how well California is preparing all students for success after high school
Assist high schools in developing innovative strategies that promote college and career readiness
Expected Applicant Outcomes:
Offer programs of study that include courses integrating core academic and CTE standards
Offer the Linked Learning approach as a district wide option for students
Serve a substantial percentage of the District's students
Serve as models of replication and laboratories during the project period
Involve business and community leaders in the planning and implementation process
Strengthen/develop agreements with their local higher education institutions and promote secondary/post secondary options such as co-enrollment, certificates of study, and early/middle college programs
Implement project-based, problem-solving, and inquiry-based teaching methodologies
Strengthen transition strategies with feeder middle grades
	 
FISCAL IMPACT:
N/A
	 
FUNDING SOURCE:
N/A
	 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees authorize the District to apply for the Linked Learning Pilot Grant.

SUBJECT:
Approve Provisional Internship Permit Requests for Certificated Employees
	 
	 
Pursuant to State mandate, the Governing Board must approve provisional internship permit requests allowing the district to employ and assign teacher(s) or administrator(s) who do not hold appropriate credential authorization.
	 
The Provisional Internship Permit (PIP) was created in response to the phasing out of emergency permits and became effective on July 1, 2006.  It allows an employing agency to hire an individual who has not yet met the subject matter competence requirement needed to enter an internship program.
	 
The district is requesting approval of the following provisional internship permit request for the 2012-2013 school year.

SUBJECT:
Adopt/Approve Classified, Classified Management and Certificated Administrative Holiday Schedule for the 2012-2013 School Calendar
					 
					 
Attached please find the proposed classified, classified management and certificated administrative holiday schedule for the 2012-2013 school calendar.
	 
CSEA, on behalf of classified employees, and the District have reached a tentative agreement on the holiday schedule and are requesting final approval from the Board of Trustees.  The proposed holiday schedule includes the contractual holidays, plus three additional paid holidays during Christmas break.  It also includes two days during the leave where employees will have the option of charging annual leave, floating holiday, compensatory time or leave without pay.  This arrangement will enable the District to shutdown all operations during the two-week break, which will result in savings in utility costs.
